Issues.Title: Build goes blank, just app-root tag in the DOM
Issues.Body:
I have this project that built the first two times and afterwards I discovered the build only renders a blank page with app-root tag and nothing else as the child not even router-outlet.

ng serve --aot - works great
ng serve --prod - works great
ng build --prod --base-href ./ - blank page

Base href points to ./
Output directory is dist/[project-name]

I use angular@8.2.14, angular-cli@8.3.25
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Build goes blank, just app-root tag in the DOM" (#36252)

Issues.Title: Angular 9 fails to refer the global type I declared in a custom type definition file
Issues.Body:
I've tried updating my angular project from Angular 8 to 9.

After the update, I entered `ng serve` to start up my app and it gave me these errors:

```javascript
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-container.component.ts:259:59 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'ICoordinate'.

259     onContextClickLink({key, coord}: {key: string, coord: ICoordinate}): void {
                                                              ~~~~~~~~~~~
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-change-notification.service.ts:52:27 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'ITransactionDetailData'.

52             filter((data: ITransactionDetailData) => {
                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-change-notification.service.ts:55:28 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'ITransactionDetailData'.

55         ).subscribe((data: ITransactionDetailData) => {
                              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-change-notification.service.ts:58:82 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'INodeInfo'.

```

I suppose it's something to do with my custom definition file which occurs no error back in Angular 8. Anyway, I declared the types which I use across the app in `globals.d.ts.` under the `src` directory and let app the know it by referring it in `tsconfig.app.json` like:

```
"include": [
   "src/**/*.d.ts"
]
```

Again, there was no problem with this approach and I'm just wondering if something has changed internally which I didn't see from their migration guide. Any insight would be appreciated!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 9 fails to refer the global type I declared in a custom type definition file" (#36251)

Currently, when we use code font, there is no obvious difference in background color and the font family doesn't set the code font apart substantially from the body copy. Because of this, sometimes it's hard to tell if a word is in code font or not. We used to have a background on the code font, but it went away (maybe about a year to 1.5 years ago, but I think it was unintentional).

Adds a background color and 3px padding left and right to the code elements in headers, tables, lists, and paragraphs.

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): correctly identify the package of targeted entry-points
Issues.Body:
In some scenarios, such as yarn workspaces, the node_modules
folder containing the target entry-point is not contained by
the original basePath passed to ngcc.

In this case, we were not computing the package path for  secondary
entry-points correctly, instead assuming that the path was the primary
entry-point.

I optimistically suggest that is PR will fix #35747,  #18637 and #36060. But I need to actually go through and check.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): correctly identify the package of targeted entry-points" (#36249)

Issues.Title: build: rebuild yarn lock from scratch
Issues.Body:
Rebuild the yarn lock file from scratch to collapse instances where
one package is able to satisfy multiple dependencies.  Currently we
have some situations where we have multiple versions when one would
work.

Example:
```
"@babel/code-frame@^7.0.0":
  version "7.0.0"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-OfC2uemaknXr87bdLUkWog7nYuliM9Ij
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.0.0"

"@babel/code-frame@^7.5.5":
  version "7.5.5"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-27d4lZoomVyo51VegxI20xZPuSHusqbQ
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.0.0"

"@babel/code-frame@^7.8.3":
  version "7.8.3"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-a9gxpmdXtZEInkCSHUJDLHZVBgb1QS0j
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.8.3"
```

becomes

```
"@babel/code-frame@^7.0.0", "@babel/code-frame@^7.5.5", "@babel/code-frame@^7.8.3":
  version "7.8.3"
  resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/@babel/cod
  integrity sha512-a9gxpmdXtZEInkCSHUJDLHZVBgb1QS0j
  dependencies:
    "@babel/highlight" "^7.8.3"
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: rebuild yarn lock from scratch" (#36231)

Issues.Title: HttpClient/HttpRequest should support fetch API-specific redirect control
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/common/http

### Description
#27689 requests a Fetch-based backend for `HttpClient`.  The only response thus far has been "feel free to implement it yourself".  I don't actually care what backend is used.  I'm trying to replace my (fetch-based) back-end interactions with HttpClient so that I can use injected mocks for testing.  The problem is that I currently use several features that are not available in the existing API, like the `cache` and `redirect` options in the [Request](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request) and the `redirected` property of [Response](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/redirected).


### Describe the solution you'd like
I'd like to see first-class Angluar support for `fetch`-specific features.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I'm talking to back-end APIs that I have no control over.  I'm either going to have to a) stick with `fetch` and figure out how to test my code on my own, or b) switch to HttpClient and rewrite significant portions of my backend interactions to detect and handle redirects that I could have avoided using a simple `{redirect: "error"}` via native `fetch`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HttpClient/HttpRequest should support fetch API-specific redirect control" (#36246)

Issues.Title: Conditional Module imports (e.g. for development only)
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Conditional Module imports (e.g. for development-only modules)

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core / ivy


### Description
View Engine allowed us to pass a module conditionally, which was useful as some modules should only be imported in development. Example:

```ts
@NgModule({
  imports: [
    process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? NgxsReduxDevtoolsPluginModule.forRoot({})  : undefined
  ]
})
```

Using Ivy, the above solution will fail when building with production target.
Running ng serve xxx --prod leads to these errors:
CLI will show lots of misguiding errors (telling me component xxx is not a known element).
Browser console will show "ASSERTION ERROR: Type passed in is not NgModuleType, it does not have '…µmod' property."

I thought Ivy might not like the undefined value, so I tried this as a workaround:

```ts
@NgModule()
export class NoopModule {}

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? NgxsReduxDevtoolsPluginModule.forRoot({})  : NoopModule 
  ]
})
```

... which lead to the same errors. 


### Describe the solution you'd like

Does Ivy support this by now, in way I don't know?
if not, I suggest to allow to pass undefined to module imports.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Conditional Module imports (e.g. for development only)" (#36243)

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request
Hi 
In angular we do have a support for Tree Shaking for Providers. Can we extend this support to provide the support the providers methods as well. Non used Methods should be removed during tree shaking.




### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/....
Not-Known



### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
Hi

We are using the generating the Angular services from yml files and these yml files can be shared between front end and backend. 

One YML file = One service

User can define many methods inside the yml files and very can be used in the UI. So if we have a the support for Tree Shaking the Providers methods then we can remove this not used/ Dead code/method from the generated angular service.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Issues.Title: fix(core): run `APP_INITIALIZER`s before accessing `LOCALE_ID` token in Ivy TestBed
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, Ivy TestBed was accessing locale ID before `APP_INITIALIZER` functions were called. This execution order is not consistent with the app bootstrap logic in the `application_ref.ts` file. This commit updates Ivy TestBed execution order to call initializers first (since they might affect `LOCALE_ID` token value) and accessing and setting locale ID after that.

Related changes were performed in the `application_ref.ts` file in PR #34830.

Fixes #36230.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): run `APP_INITIALIZER`s before accessing `LOCALE_ID` token in Ivy TestBed" (#36237)

Issues.Title: LOCALE_ID accessed in tests before APP_INITIALIZER runs (with Ivy)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ^8.2.0 (not using Ivy) This also works if @angular/core is not processed by `ngcc` (when the tests use ViewEngine instead of Ivy) - we use jest, which does not call `ngcc` automatically like the default Angular CLI setup with karma, so we can test both scenarios easily in our private project repository. ### Description There was a pull request (#34830) that ensured all `APP_INITIALIZER` functions are executed before `LOCALE_ID` is first accessed. This works correctly when the application is served (whether the initializer is synchronous or asynchronous). But when running tests, this is not happening. The `LOCALE_ID` is accessed before `APP_INITIALIZER` functions are executed, thus ending in the locale being undefined. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/IgorAufricht/angular-locale-id-test-repro The steps are included in the readme, but for clarity, here they are: * `git clone https://github.com/IgorAufricht/angular-locale-id-test-repro` * `npm install` * `ng serve` (application loads correctly, console confirms that `LOCALE_ID = fr-FR`) * `ng test` (fails, `Error: Expected '' to equal 'fr-FR'`) **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.7
Node: 12.13.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.0.7

... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic

Issues.Title: A9 - IE11 mixes up i18n units when lazy loaded
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/localize? (still unclear what the culprit is) ### Is this a regression? Yes, this was working in A8 ### Description We are experiencing a regression in IE11 after upgrade to A9. A somewhat complex page consisting of factoried components is showing completely-mixed-up i18n units. (This doesn't happen in evergreen browsers). We have temporarily worked around it by turning off lazy-loading for this page (if anyone can suggest a way to conditionally eager-load only in es5 compilation and not for evergreen, that would serve as a workaround for our purposes). We have seen several errors, all related to `i18nStartFirstPass` as seen here or `getBindingMask` (which errors on .length on undefined .values in this line `for (var i = 0; i < icuExpression.values.length; i++) {`) Since the i18n compile goes fine, and this works in evergreen browsers, we're not thinking there's a problem with any of our ICUs? Here are some screenshots of the real app, as well as the stack trace, relevant code and messages.xlf for the unit it's currently choking on (which, as you can see, is uninteresting). #### Chrome: ![Chrome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20215564/77440120-ee22fd00-6db5-11ea-9d29-a066d5540853.png) #### IE11: ![IE11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20215564/77440145-f54a0b00-6db5-11ea-840c-5e23bcb18d36.png) #### Stack trace ``` "Error: Unable to parse ICU expression in "{VAR_SELECT, select, MIPS_GRP_113_overall {Screening for colorectal (colon or rectum) cancer}}" message. at i18nStartFirstPass (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:151562:17) at …µ…µi18nStart (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:151423:9) at …µ…µi18n (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:152485:7) at ProviderDetailsNursingHomeOverviewComponent_Template (http://10.0.0.132:8080/2-es5.e3644e6c21e2fdb0ea5c.js:12859:13) at executeTemplate (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124580:9) at renderView (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124289:11) at renderComponent (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:126255:7) at renderChildComponents (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124023:9) at renderView (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124327:11) at create (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.7959501" ``` #### Template code & messages.xlf Template: (complete template available in `real-problem-screenshots` in repro repo) ``` {measure.measureId, select, MIPS_GRP_113_overall {Screening for colorectal (colon or rectum) cancer}} ``` messages.xlf: ``` {VAR_SELECT, select, MIPS_GRP_113_overall {Screening for colorectal (colon or rectum) cancer} } ../../libs/features/provider-measures/src/lib/components/group-practice/performance/performance.component.html 128 ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Unfortunately our efforts to create a minimal repro by throwing a large amount of factoried data components from multiple modules at the screen did not succeed; here is that code: https://github.com/pburkindine/angular9-ie11-i18n The `real-problem-screenshots` folder in the repo has all the real app details provided here ## üî• Exception or Error ``` "Error: Unable to parse ICU expression in "{VAR_SELECT, select, MIPS_GRP_113_overall {Screening for colorectal (colon or rectum) cancer}}" message. at i18nStartFirstPass (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:151562:17) at …µ…µi18nStart (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:151423:9) at …µ…µi18n (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:152485:7) at ProviderDetailsNursingHomeOverviewComponent_Template (http://10.0.0.132:8080/2-es5.e3644e6c21e2fdb0ea5c.js:12859:13) at executeTemplate (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124580:9) at renderView (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124289:11) at renderComponent (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:126255:7) at renderChildComponents (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124023:9) at renderView (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.795950121ed4b72ff95a.js:124327:11) at create (http://10.0.0.132:8080/main-es5.7959501" ``` ## Issues.Title: build: allow custom module resolution for ts-circular-deps tests
Issues.Body:
Currently the `ts-circular-deps` tool uses a hard-coded module resolver
that only works in the `angular/angular` repository.

If the tool is consumed in other repositories through the shared
dev-infra package, the module resolution won't work, and a few
resolvable imports (usually cross-entry-points) are accidentally skipped.
For each test, the resolution might differ, so tests can now configure their
module resolution in a configuration file.

Note that we intentionally don't rely on tsconfig's for module
resolution as parsing their mappings rather complicates the
circular dependency tool. Additionally, not every test has a
corresponding tsconfig file.

Also, hard-coding mappings to `@angular/*` while accepting a path
to the packages folder would work, but it would mean that the circular
deps tool is no longer self-contained. Rather, and also for better flexibility,
a custom resolver should be specified.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: allow custom module resolution for ts-circular-deps tests" (#36226)

Issues.Title: Core update schematic should update Typescript
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [X] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Update schematic should update TypeScript dependency too. Changelog for current Angular Core says that TypeScript was updated to version 3.8 but the schematic is not taking care of that.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14895873/77565535-205e5880-6ea3-11ea-9c4d-ba522740b1c3.png)


### Describe the solution you'd like
Angular core schematic should update Typescript for the required version, update `package.json` and notify in update log. I don't know if the same approach for RxJS update it's better or not, something like: `ng update typescript`.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only workaround is to update via `npm` but that could lead to some issues.

Issues.Title: NG Update 9.0  (please help)
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

 
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


 


### Description

When using NG Update which we've been doing for many different solutions for quite a while now, we find these types of issues.

The Global and Dev environments will be out of sync.  Perhaps the Global will make it to 9 but often we have to handhold the Dev updates using NPM Install which even when specifying the exact same version and a component in Global, doesn't exactly match that version.  A good example was all Globals reached 9.0.1 but dev versions went to 9.0.2.

NG Update seems to bypass the Angular/CLI itself.  This forces another NPM install to sync up dev and global.   


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
[Create a new ASP.NET 31 Angular solution and try NG Update](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/client-side/spa/angular?view=aspnetcore-3.1&tabs=visual-studio)


 
 We are running on a Windows 10 environment with latest Node and NPM.  We have tried installing Angular/Cli@latest to start, we have just used the Angular/Cli around version 8....  Things do not go smooth.

Issues.Title: Capability of seeding unique hash values for aot compilations
Issues.Body:
as far as I know, the hash values in the filenames are based on the file content itself.
However, I have recently came across an issue that our font files were cached with incorrect content-types. It's more unfortunate that those files were set a year max age of public cache headers.
so normally our users can't simply reload the font files with correct content-type headers by refreshing the page specifically our mobile users. 

From the angular cli itself, there seems not be no options seeding the filename hash so it's not an easy task to change the built filenames as basically the font itself will rarely change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Capability of seeding unique hash values for aot compilations " (#17289)

Issues.Title: `Event is undefined` is thrown when running ng-serve
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Unknown ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.2.3 ### Description `Event is undefined` is thrown when running ng-serve, further investigating resolves this is caused by importing a package which is built as an Angular library and exported as umd package. When running ng serve in the project where the library is built it will run the serve without any errors. The code that causes the issue is defined on a component exported by the library: ``` @HostListener('window:beforeunload', ['$event']) onBeforeUnload(event: Event) { if (this.state.pendingChanges) { event.returnValue = true; } } ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - Create a library project containing a component that has uses a `@HostListener` with an `Event` as argument and build the files. - Use the built library in an angular project as NPM package. - Run `ng serve`. ## üî• Exception or Error 
ReferenceError: Event is not defined

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Custom Component Themes): Custom components themes need updated
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

I've been using Angular for over a year now and the page for custom component theming either needs removed or redone. It causes a lot more confusion that it has ever helped and the example is quite case specific and you simply can do a Google search to see there are absolutely _tons_ of confusion about this. Just look at [this](https://stackoverflow.com/a/58873540/3017217) answer on Stack Overflow, it's a prime example. It's not simple, not well documented, and Googling my problems usually are just leads to work around because of the lack of documentation. I'd like to help the documentation, but anyone hardly know how it works.


**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/guide/theming-your-components

Issues.Title: bug(MatCheckbox): Checkbox not disabled when form is disabled.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-g38766?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-com

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a form with a checkbox. Have it enabled in your form definition.
2. Disable form in ngOnInit. All fields become disabled and the disabled() method on the checkbox form element is true, but the checkbox behaves like it's still enabled.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Checkbox should be disabled like the rest of the fields.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Checkbox stays enabled.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9
- CDK/Material: 9
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatCheckbox): Checkbox not disabled when form is disabled." (#18923)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-expansion-panel): Focus and hover backgrounds cannot be overridden in CSS
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nlepch Steps to reproduce:
  1. Hover over a collapsed header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
  2. Expand the first panel
  3. Click in the first name field
  4. Hover over the expanded header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
  5. Tap tab twice to put keyboard focus on the 2nd panel header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
#### Expected Behavior Use the background color specified in CSS, for normal, hover, and focus states. #### Actual Behavior On hover over a collapsed header, the component is forcing a specific background color. On hover over an expanded header, the component is forcing its background to inherit from the panel itself. When keyboard focus is placed into a collapsed header, the component is forcing a specific background color. The only way to override this is seemingly to use **!important** or to override the generic mat-expansion-panel-header class. This appears to be a regression as it worked in some prior version of Angular Material (though I can't say exactly which). #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.7 - CDK/Material: 9.1.3 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System : Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-expansion-panel): Focus and hover backgrounds cannot be overridden in CSS" (#18920)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): defer resolving scrollable parents until first drag
Issues.Body:
Currently we resolve a drop list's scrollable parents inside `ngAfterViewInit`, but this might be too early if the element is being projected. These changes move the logic to the first time the user starts dragging which should guarantee that the DOM structure has settled.

Fixes #18737.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): defer resolving scrollable parents until first drag" (#18918)

Issues.Title: help([google-maps/map-marker]): setOptions or setVisible...
Issues.Body:
Hello,

how call setOptions or setVisible for a marker ? (after init, display)

for exemple marker.title is callable but not marker.options or marker.setOptions:

(property) MapMarker.options: google.maps.MarkerOptions
This expression is not callable.
  Type 'MarkerOptions' has no call signatures

Sample code:

> <map-marker #markerElem
>                                                             [position]="gMap.marker.position"
>                                                             [options]="gMap.marker.options"
>                                                             (mapDragend)="mapMarkerDragEnd( markerElem)">

> mapMarkerDragEnd(marker: MapMarker) {
>         marker.title = "changed title"; // works
>         marker.setOptions({visible:false}); // doesn't works
>         // marker.options.visible = false ? // doesn't works
>         //marker.visible = false ? // doesn't works
>     }

Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

```
polyfills-es2015.7334d7c49db06a58f6f3.js:1 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'clientRect' of undefined
    at Ee._sortItem (12-es2015.57b2cc973d6f19b5358e.js:1)
    at ve._updateActiveDropContainer (12-es2015.57b2cc973d6f19b5358e.js:1)
    at c._pointerMove [as _next] (12-es2015.57b2cc973d6f19b5358e.js:1)
    at c.__tryOrUnsub (main-es2015.83cbb10447d7abc76ea5.js:1)
    at c.next (main-es2015.83cbb10447d7abc76ea5.js:1)
    at u._next (main-es2015.83cbb10447d7abc76ea5.js:1)
    at u.next (main-es2015.83cbb10447d7abc76ea5.js:1)
    at e.next (main-es2015.83cbb10447d7abc76ea5.js:1)
    at HTMLDocument.handler (12-es2015.57b2cc973d6f19b5358e.js:1)
    at a.invokeTask (polyfills-es2015.7334d7c49db06a58f6f3.js:1)
```
2.  
```
main-es2015.83cbb10447d7abc76ea5.js:1 ERROR DOMException: Failed to execute 'removeChild' on 'Node': The node to be removed is not a child of this node.

Issues.Title: bug(Material Checkbox): focused styles works only for keyboard-focused checkboxes
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-zyqjwi

Steps to reproduce:
1. Place `Material Checkbox` after `Material Menu Trigger` button. (Maybe exist more scenarios)
2. `Tab` out from menu
 
#### Expected Behavior

`Material Checkbox` focused and has focused styles.

#### Actual Behavior

`Material Checkbox` focused but but does not have any focused styles.

Current behavior based on the next rule from `src/material/checkbox/checkbox.scss`:
```
.mat-checkbox.cdk-keyboard-focused & {
    opacity: 0.12;
}
``` 


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0-next.4
- CDK/Material: 9.1.3
- Browser(s): It does not matter
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): It does not matter

Issues.Title: refactor: remove unused sass variables in non-theme files
Issues.Body:
We have a couple of unused variables in Sass files which aren't
shipped to the consumers. This means that these variables can
be removed immediately without any deprecation period or breaking
change notice.

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): provide horizontal fallback positions
Issues.Body:
The positions for the autocomplete dropdown are set up assuming that the panel's width will match the input so they don't provide fallbacks along the x axis. Since we have a `panelWidth` input, the consumer might've overwritten the width to something different so we need to provide the fallbacks to ensure that the panel is always inside the viewport.

Fixes #18854.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): provide horizontal fallback positions" (#18906)

Issues.Title: fix(slider): not stopping drag when released outside of viewport
Issues.Body:
We're binding the slider events to the `document.body` which means that we won't pick up the ones that happen outside the viewport. These changes move the events to the `document`.

Fixes #18888.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(slider): not stopping drag when released outside of viewport" (#18905)

Issues.Title: Add density styles for non-experimental components without MDC equivalent
Issues.Body: **Note**: I wasn't sure how and whether we should do `expansion`. The height is hard-coded into an `@angular/animation` transition. We could/should revisit this in a follow-up? The problem I see here is that expansion actually provides inputs for specifying height. That doesn't play nicely with density.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add density styles for non-experimental components without MDC equivalent" (#18903)

Issues.Title: MAT-SELECT: On window resize some options from the mat-select options (mat-options) cannot be seen or selected
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-lr4cn8

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Build a mat-select with more than 6 options
2. Shrink the window to about 300 px height,
3. center the mat select in those 300 px, 
4. Click on the mat-select
5. Observe that the last/first elements are not in view even though you can scroll up to the last/first element. 

![sw-select-issue-first image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/365737/77429885-03625080-6de3-11ea-9d0b-0f5c1148e264.png)

![sw-select-issue-second-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/365737/77429921-11b06c80-6de3-11ea-834e-11ec4482aa3f.png)

 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The expected behavior should be that i would be able to scroll to the last/first element and that the last element should be seen in the window.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Even though i can scroll up to the last/first element they're not visible in the window


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0
- CDK/Material: 9.1.3
- Browser(s): Google Chrome Version 80.0.3987.132 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MAT-SELECT: On window resize some options from the mat-select options (mat-options) cannot be seen or selected" (#18901)
